nodes.text: Tenara was a planet that was located within the Tenara system, a part of the Gordian Reach sector in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories and Trans-Hydian regions. A small hyperlane connected the world to the planet Korphir.

Centuries before the year 43 ABY, Tenara served as a bolt-hole for pirates from Korphir. The pirates used hidden vaults on Tenara to stash their stolen loot, and the planet gained a reputation as a fabled treasure world as a result.

By 43 ABY, Tenara was no longer used by the Korphiri pirates as a hide-out, and was instead a farming world. Tenara's inhabitants offered sightseeing tours of the old and dusty pirate hiding places in order to earn extra credits.
Tenara was first mentioned in the 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas, written by Jason Fry and Daniel Wallace, which placed the planet in grid square Q-6.
